action: I want to track major KPIs such as sales, progress, and customer status in real-time
reason: To make decisions quickly and based on data evidence
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard viewing is only possible for authenticated users.
KPI viewing permissions are controlled by roles.
Displayed data is limited only to data within the user's permission range.
Sales KPIs can be toggled by specifying periods (Day/Week/Month/Year).
Progress rate KPIs can be displayed on a per-project basis.
Graph displays support line charts, bar charts, and pie charts.
Numerical data and graphs are retrieved from the same data source.
Data updates are performed via periodic batches or real-time APIs.
Data retrieval APIs respond within 1 second.
A caching mechanism is applied to the displayed data.
Cache update timing is configurable.
Aggregation processing is performed asynchronously, considering DB load.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Input filter values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Errors occur when an invalid period is specified.
Periods with no existing data are displayed as 0.
Numerical values are displayed localized (with digit separators).
Time zones follow user settings.
Fallback displays are shown during graph rendering errors.
Dashboard viewing logs are stored.
Export functionality (CSV/PDF) is available.
Export processing is executed after a permission check.
The design ensures no response degradation even during increased concurrent access.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Internal information is not returned during API errors.
Responsive design is implemented to support mobile screen sizes.
The display layout can be saved for each user.
Show/hide can be toggled on a per-widget basis.
Audit logs are recorded when the data source is changed.
A history of dashboard setting changes is maintained.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
